com.xith3d.render
Interface RenderAtom

All Superinterfaces:
StateSortable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BackgroundColorAtom, BoundsAtom, RenderAtomBase, ShapeAtom
public interface RenderAtom
extends StateSortable

A render atom is a discrete chunk of geometry and shader that will be drawn. Render atoms are submitted to a rendering peer which is API specific.

Copyright (c) 2003 David Yazel Copyright (c) 2003

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
David Yazel

Method Detail

getNode

public Node getNode()
The underlying scenegraph node that generated the atom. From this we can get the bounds, location, etc. In addition peers are allowed to cache information in the node using methods provided for this purpose.

Returns:

setNode

public void setNode(Node node)

getTransform

public Transform3D getTransform()
The transform used for this atom.

Returns:

setTransform

public void setTransform(Transform3D transform)

addShader

public void addShader(Shader shader)
The shaders associated with this atom. This can be almost anything that sets the graphics state prior to rendering the geometry.

Returns:

getData

public Object getData()
The data which is associated with rendering this atom. This might be a geometry array, or this could be a subdivision surface which will be generating the triangles on the fly.

Returns:

setSata

public void setSata(Object data)

public void getPosition(javax.vecmath.Point3f p)

getOrderedState

public OrderedState getOrderedState()
Returns the ordered state for this render atom. If this is not in an ordered group then this returns null. The ordered state is
